etymology.description: 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") + 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") = stylized piled earth -> representation of an ancient jade tablet used in rituals
etymology.interpretation: 圭(圭) (guī, "jade tablet") features two 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") stacked, signifying prestige and ritual significance, as jade tablets were made from earth-origin materials and held ceremonial importance.

examples.chinese: 博物馆中陈列着一块圭(博物館中陳列著一塊圭)。
examples.pinyin: Bówùguǎn zhōng chénliè zhe yī kuài guī.
examples.english: The museum displays a jade tablet.

examples.chinese: 考古学家在遗址中发现了圭(考古學家在遺址中發現了圭)，暗示着当时礼仪制度(暗示著當時禮儀制度)。
examples.pinyin: Kǎogǔ xuéjiā zài yízhǐ zhōng fāxiàn le guī, ànshì zhe dāngshí lǐyí zhìdù.
examples.english: The archaeologist discovered a jade tablet at the site, suggesting the ceremonial customs of that time.
